message.content:
cs.IT, cs.LG, cs.SP, cs.MM, cs.NA. 

The paper deals with the simultaneous recovery of sparse signals under a multiple measurement vector model, which is a problem commonly studied in the information theory (cs.IT) and signal processing (cs.SP) communities. The proposed lower bound is based on the maximal inner product of atoms from a dictionary and the current signal residual, which is a key metric in sparse signal recovery algorithms. This suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the machine learning (cs.LG) and mathematical modeling (cs.MM) communities. Finally, the paper proposes a new bound that outperforms state-of-the-art results, which suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the numerical analysis (cs.NA) community.
